intro: Callaeum nicaraguense, commonly known as the Nicaraguan callaeum, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually opposite and ovate, while its stems are woody and can reach several meters in height. The flowers are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological importance in its native habitat.
